programmes.show_description: 1/3. In the first episode, Bronwen Lewis explores the ground-breaking careers of country music's early female icons, such as Patsy Cline, Loretta Lynn and Linda Martell.

programmes.show_name: Dance Sounds of the 90s with Vernon Kay
programmes.show_description: Vernon Kay is behind the decks with a record bag full of 90s dance hits that all feature male vocals - including Bobby Brown, De'Lacy, Armand Van Helden, Faithless and The Prodigy.
Kicking off Radio 2's Piano Room Month 2025 in style, Coldplay perform three exclusive tracks, and they chat to Jo Whiley about their rise from uni band to globe-conquering giants.
Singer songwriter Cat Burns performs live at Maida Vale with the BBC Concert Orchestra. Featuring Go, People Pleaser, and a reimagining of Ariana Grande's pov.
Tom Grennan's live set featuring his breakthrough hit, Little Bit of Love, latest single Shadowboxing, and a cover of the classic power ballad, Without You.
RAYE performs live at Maida Vale with the BBC Concert Orchestra. Featuring Love Me Again, Oscar Winning Tears and her cover of the Bill Withers classic, Ain't No Sunshine.
James Morrison introduces music from the Desford Colliery Band, Natalie Cressman, Red Rodney, Jim Self, Chase and Albert Mangelsdorff, plus covers of Stevie Wonder and Frankie Valli.
Daryl Hall performing at the London Forum in 1993. Featuring I'm in a Philly Mood, Love T.K.O., Me and Mrs. Jones, I Can't Go for That (No Can Do) and Maneater.
The writer behind The Gruffalo, Stick Man, Zog and many more, Julia Donaldson joins Vernon to select her ten Tracks Of My Years ahead of World Book Day on 5th March 2026.
The Reverend Kate Bottley and Jason Mohammad spread hope and joy, with uplifting stories about life, love and modern spirituality, alongside a great soundtrack for Sunday morning.
Your stories, dedications and classic love songs with Michael... easy like Sunday morning.
Paddy's live from Salford every Sunday, with The Weekest Link quiz and your Sunday Dinners.
Dame Elaine is back from her winter break, and she's unpacking your favourite show tunes, as well as the latest stage and screen news and the return of your Break A Leg messages!

programmes.show_name: Sounds of the 70s with Bob Harris
programmes.show_description: Bob's 'Best of the Test' features the debut performance of Gary Numan with Tubeway Army from the Old Grey Whistle Test in 1979.
Mark Goodier counts down the chart from this day in 1985.
Mark Goodier counts down the chart from this day in 1998.
Tony Blackburn spins his personal pick of the hits from across the decades. To listen on most smart speakers, just 'ask BBC Sounds to play Tony Blackburn's Golden Hour'.
Has March 1st given us more musicians' birthdays than any other date? We celebrate Glenn Miller, Roger Daltrey, Justin Bieber, Kesha, Mike D'Abo, Nik Kershaw & Harry Belafonte.
Angela Griffin has music from Bob Marley, Janet Jackson and Mariah Carey to help you slow down and unwind.

programmes.show_name: Radio 2 Unwinds Mix with Angela Griffin
programmes.show_description: Angela Griffin has a mix of music to soothe you, from Nelly Furtado, Marvin Gaye and Fleetwood Mac.
Richie Anderson is live from Salford with your Monday Motivation to kick start a brand new week, plus Secret Star and This Week in Songs.

programmes.show_name: Alternative Sounds of the 90s with Dermot O'Leary
programmes.show_description: Let's hear it for the girls...named in 90s indie song titles from the likes of Elastica, Bjork, Hole, Nirvana, Beck & Blur.
Welcome! It's Early Breakfast with Owain Wyn Evans, featuring Airdrum Anthems and Step Back in Time!
Jonathan Ross is on the show... plus Scott and the team go through the Mailbag. Also, the Birthday Game and the Easiest Quiz on the Radio.
Writer of The Gruffalo and now Britain's bestselling author, Julia Donaldson is Vernon's guest for Tracks Of My Years this week in the build up to World Book Day.
Jeremy and guests discuss the news headlines and talk to the people making them.
Trevor is bringing you some of the best music from across the decades to get you through the afternoon.
Sara gets you through teatime with giggles and some fab music. Plus she reveals the new phrase for this week's Totally Teavoted and a listener plays Jukebox Jam!
Sara plays the biggest and best tunes to get you up dancing!
Jo brings her Shiny Happy Playlist, 30 minutes of feel-good music from 7-7.30pm to soundtrack listeners' weekday evening.
Jo handpicks her favourite new music from all genres of the musical spectrum and quality vintage songs too.

programmes.show_name: The Blues Show with Cerys Matthews
programmes.show_description: Soul, gospel and R&B singer Ruby Turner shares her favourite blues records with Cerys. Known for her collaborations with Jools Holland, Ruby has released 17 albums.

programmes.show_name: The Good Groove with DJ Spoony
programmes.show_description: Feel-good tunes to make you groove. 'Dr. Beat' is also on hand to prescribe a perfect tune for a listener whose week hasn't got off to the best start!
